description: Airing on Friday, April 3, 2015: The Nevada Supreme Court is running out of money because it’s funded by traffic tickets, and Nevada police are ticketing less. We look at the perils of unsound funding mechanisms. Plus, new jobs numbers are out this morning. How do these these numbers reflect on the ongoing economic recovery and why do wage increases remain sluggish? We investigate. Plus, the hotel business is a competitive one. One way high-end boutique joints stand out is with their art—but not always at a fine-art prices. Turns out, the hotels are using “art curators” to stand out, while employing digital printing and mass production to do it cheaply.
